description: From Middle English odious, from Old French odieus, from Latin odiōsus, from odium (“hate”).

adjectives.description: odious (comparative more odious, superlative most odious)

entries.meaning: Arousing or meriting strong dislike, aversion, or intense displeasure.
examples: Scrubbing the toilets in the bar at the end of a Saturday night is an odious task.
